Class CuBridge

java.lang.Object
CuBridge
public class CuBridge extends Object
CuBridge: A Java-CUDA bridge class for high-performance numerical computation.

This class defines tensor-based numerical operations in Java and delegates their execution to either CPU or GPU (via CUDA) depending on system capabilities. Operations are automatically routed to the appropriate memory location (RAM or VRAM), and communication between Java and CUDA kernels is managed through JNI.

Design Principles

  • Instruction-Execution Model: Operations are instructed in Java, executed natively via CUDA or CPU.
  • RAM and VRAM Separation: If CUDA is available, operations are executed on the GPU; otherwise, fallback to CPU.

Data Storage Architecture

  • Queue (Execution Queue): All computations are queued and results are popped sequentially.
  • Map (Persistent Memory): Tensors stored with specific names have usageCount -1, meaning they persist indefinitely.
  • The queue is a circular buffer where tensors are automatically removed when usageCount reaches zero.
  • All memory is reset when clean() is called, including both the queue and the map.

Main Features

  • Unary and binary math operations (e.g., sqrt, log, add, div)
  • Axis-based statistical functions (sum, mean, std, etc.)
  • Broadcasting and tensor reshaping (compress, expand, transpose)
  • Neural network specialized functions (mse, cee, affine, softmax)

Function Overview

Function Overview
Function Type Representative Functions Total Functions (Including Overloads)
Unary Operations abs, neg, square, sqrt, log 63
Binary Operations add, sub, mul, div, dot 64
Axis-based Operations sum, mean, var, std, argmax 30
Neural Network Functions mse, cee, affine, softmax 13
Broadcast / Reshape Functions transpose, compress, expand 12

Example Usage


 CuBridge cb = CuBridge.getInstance();
 cb.put(1.0, "x").put(2.0, "y").add("x", "y", "z");
 Tensor result = cb.get("z");

Notes

  • CuBridgeJNI is an internal implementation class and should not be accessed directly. All functions must be invoked through CuBridge.
  • clean() will remove all stored tensors and reset both the queue and map to their initial state.

Related Libraries and Modules

Tensor // Multidimensional array structure for data representation
Since:
1.0

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    CuBridge
    abs()
    Applies absolute value (|x|) to the top tensor in the queue. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    abs(String a)
    Applies absolute value (|x|) to the specified tensor. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    abs(String a, String out)
    Applies absolute value (|x|) to the specified tensor and stores the result under a new name. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    add()
    Applies element-wise addition (a + b) to the top two tensors in the queue. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    add(String a)
    Applies element-wise addition (a + b) using the specified tensor as the first operand. The second operand is taken from the top of the queue. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    add(String a, String b)
    Applies element-wise addition (a + b) using the two specified tensors. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    add(String a, String b, String out)
    Applies element-wise addition (a + b) using the two specified tensors and stores the result. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    affine()
    Performs affine transformation: a · b + c. Ensure the last axis of tensor a matches the second-to-last axis of tensor b for valid dot product. Tensor c must have the same size as the number of columns in the resulting matrix (i.e., last axis of b). Broadcasting is allowed for tensor c; its broadcasting setting does not affect correctness. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    affine(String a)
    Performs affine transformation: a · b + c using the specified input tensor a. The dot product a · b requires the last axis of a to match the second-to-last axis of b. Tensor c must match the output column size (last axis of b), and may be broadcasted. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    affine(String a, String b)
    Performs affine transformation: a · b + c using the specified tensors a and b. Ensure the last axis of a equals the second-to-last axis of b for valid matrix multiplication. Tensor c must match the number of columns in b and may be broadcasted if needed. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    affine(String a, String b, String c)
    Performs affine transformation: a · b + c using the specified tensors a, b, and c. Valid dot product requires last axis of a = second-to-last axis of b. c must have the same size as the output column dimension (last axis of b), and broadcasting is allowed. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    affine(String a, String b, String c, String out)
    Performs affine transformation: a · b + c and stores the result in the specified output tensor. Valid dot product requires last axis of a = second-to-last axis of b. c must match the output's column count and may be broadcasted regardless of its setting. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    and()
    Applies element-wise logical AND to the top two tensors in the queue.
    CuBridge
    and(String a)
    Applies element-wise logical AND using the specified tensor as the first operand.
    CuBridge
    and(String a, String b)
    Applies element-wise logical AND using the two specified tensors.
    CuBridge
    and(String a, String b, String out)
    Applies element-wise logical AND using the two specified tensors and stores the result.
    CuBridge
    argmax(int axis)
    Finds the index of the maximum value along the specified axis of the top tensor in the queue.
    CuBridge
    argmax(String a, int axis)
    Finds the index of the maximum value along the specified axis of the given tensor.
    CuBridge
    argmax(String a, int axis, String out)
    Finds the index of the maximum value along the specified axis of the given tensor and stores the result.
    CuBridge
    argmin(int axis)
    Finds the index of the minimum value along the specified axis of the top tensor in the queue.
    CuBridge
    argmin(String a, int axis)
    Finds the index of the minimum value along the specified axis of the given tensor.
    CuBridge
    argmin(String a, int axis, String out)
    Finds the index of the minimum value along the specified axis of the given tensor and stores the result.
    boolean
    CalStat()
    Returns the current computation mode.
    CuBridge
    cee()
    Computes the Cross-Entropy Error (CEE) loss between the top two tensors in the queue. Returns a scalar (1x1 tensor) representing the total loss. Both tensors must have the same shape. If any input contains negative values, the result will be NaN. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    cee(String yh)
    Computes the CEE loss between the specified prediction tensor and the top target tensor. Returns a scalar (1x1 tensor) representing the total loss. Both tensors must have the same shape. If any input contains negative values, the result will be NaN. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    cee(String yh, String y)
    Computes the CEE loss between the specified prediction and target tensors. Returns a scalar (1x1 tensor) representing the total loss. Both tensors must have the same shape. If any input contains negative values, the result will be NaN. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    cee(String yh, String y, String out)
    Computes the CEE loss between the specified prediction and target tensors and stores the result. Returns a scalar (1x1 tensor) representing the total loss in the specified output tensor. Both tensors must have the same shape. If any input contains negative values, the result will be NaN. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    ceil()
    Applies ceiling operation (rounding up) for each element of the top tensor in the queue. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    ceil(String name)
    Applies ceiling operation (rounding up) for each element of the specified tensor. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    ceil(String name, String out)
    Applies ceiling operation (rounding up) for each element of the specified tensor and stores the result. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    void
    clear()
    Clears all tensors from the internal queue and memory.
    CuBridge
    compress(int axis)
    Compresses the specified axis of the top tensor by summing its values. Only the specified axis is compressed; all other axes remain unchanged. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    compress(int axis, boolean avg)
    Compresses the specified axis of the top tensor by either summing or averaging its values. Set avg to true to use average, or false to use sum. Only the specified axis is compressed; all other axes remain unchanged. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    compress(String a, int axis)
    Compresses the specified axis of the given tensor by summing its values. Only the specified axis is compressed; all other axes remain unchanged. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    compress(String a, int axis, boolean avg)
    Compresses the specified axis of the given tensor by either summing or averaging its values. Set avg to true to use average, or false to use sum. Only the specified axis is compressed; all other axes remain unchanged. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    compress(String a, int axis, boolean avg, String out)
    Compresses the specified axis of the given tensor by either summing or averaging its values and stores the result. Set avg to true to use average, or false to use sum. Only the specified axis is compressed; all other axes remain unchanged. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    compress(String a, int axis, String out)
    Compresses the specified axis of the given tensor by summing its values and stores the result under a new name. Only the specified axis is compressed; all other axes remain unchanged. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    cos()
    Applies cosine (cos x) to the top tensor in the queue. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    cos(String name)
    Applies cosine (cos x) to the specified tensor. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    cos(String name, String out)
    Applies cosine (cos x) to the specified tensor and stores the result under a new name. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    div()
    Applies element-wise division (a ÷ b) to the top two tensors in the queue. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    div(String a)
    Applies element-wise division (a ÷ b) using the specified tensor as the first operand. The second operand is taken from the top of the queue. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    div(String a, String b)
    Applies element-wise division (a ÷ b) using the two specified tensors. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    div(String a, String b, String out)
    Applies element-wise division (a ÷ b) using the two specified tensors and stores the result. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    dot()
    Performs dot product (a ⋅ b) between the last two axes of the top two tensors in the queue. The last axis of a must match the second-to-last axis of b. All other axes must match. Use transpose() to reshape 1D vectors to (n,1) if needed.
    CuBridge
    dot(String a)
    Performs dot product (a ⋅ b) using the specified tensor as the first operand. The second operand is taken from the top of the queue. The last axis of a must match the second-to-last axis of b. All leading axes must match. Reshape 1D vectors to (n,1) if necessary.
    CuBridge
    dot(String a, String b)
    Performs dot product (a ⋅ b) using the two specified tensors. The last axis of a must match the second-to-last axis of b. All other axes must be equal. If either tensor is a 1D vector, use transpose() to convert it to (n,1).
    CuBridge
    dot(String a, String b, String out)
    Performs dot product (a ⋅ b) between the last two axes of the two specified tensors and stores the result. The last axis of a must match the second-to-last axis of b. All leading axes must have the same shape; otherwise, the operation fails. Use transpose() to reshape 1D vectors to (n, 1) if needed.
    CuBridge
    duple(String name, int usageCount)
    Increases the usage count of an existing tensor in the execution queue. This method searches for a tensor with the given name in the current queue and increments its internal usage count. The tensor itself is not duplicated or copied; only its metadata is updated. Note: This operation is local to the execution queue and does not interact with the map. If the usage count is less than 1, or the tensor is not found in the queue, the operation fails.
    void
    envReset()
    Resets the environment to auto-detection mode.
    boolean
    EnvStat()
    Returns whether the system is in auto-detection mode.
    CuBridge
    eq()
    Applies element-wise equality comparison (a == b) to the top two tensors in the queue. If the values are equal, returns 1; otherwise, returns 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    eq(String a)
    Applies element-wise equality comparison (a == b) using the specified tensor as the first operand. The second operand is taken from the top of the queue. If the values are equal, returns 1; otherwise, returns 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    eq(String a, String b)
    Applies element-wise equality comparison (a == b) using the two specified tensors. If the values are equal, returns 1; otherwise, returns 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    eq(String a, String b, String out)
    Applies element-wise equality comparison (a == b) using the two specified tensors and stores the result. If the values are equal, returns 1; otherwise, returns 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    exp()
    Applies exponential function (exp) to the top tensor in the queue. Uses the formula: exp(x) = e^x for each element. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    exp(String name)
    Applies exponential function (exp) to the specified tensor. Uses the formula: exp(x) = e^x for each element. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    exp(String name, String out)
    Applies exponential function (exp) to the specified tensor and stores the result under a new name. Uses the formula: exp(x) = e^x for each element. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    expand(int axis, int n)
    Repeats the elements along the specified axis of the top tensor n times. This operation only works if the size of the given axis is exactly 1. If the condition is not met or the tensor is not found, an error message is printed and the operation fails.
    CuBridge
    expand(String a, int axis, int n)
    Repeats the elements along the specified axis of the given tensor n times. This operation only works if the size of the given axis is exactly 1. If the condition is not met or the tensor is not found, an error message is printed and the operation fails.
    CuBridge
    expand(String a, int axis, int n, String out)
    Repeats the elements along the specified axis of the given tensor n times and stores the result under a new name. This operation only works if the size of the given axis is exactly 1. If the condition is not met or the tensor is not found, an error message is printed and the operation fails.
    CuBridge
    floor()
    Applies floor operation (rounding down) for each element of the top tensor in the queue. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    floor(String name)
    Applies floor operation (rounding down) for each element of the specified tensor. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    floor(String name, String out)
    Applies floor operation (rounding down) for each element of the specified tensor and stores the result. All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    ge()
    Applies element-wise greater-than-or-equal comparison (a ≥ b) to the top two tensors in the queue. If the condition is true, the result is 1; otherwise, 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    ge(String a)
    Applies element-wise greater-than-or-equal comparison (a ≥ b) using the specified tensor as the first operand. The second operand is taken from the top of the queue. If the condition is true, the result is 1; otherwise, 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    ge(String a, String b)
    Applies element-wise greater-than-or-equal comparison (a ≥ b) using the two specified tensors. If the condition is true, the result is 1; otherwise, 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    ge(String a, String b, String out)
    Applies element-wise greater-than-or-equal comparison (a ≥ b) using the two specified tensors and stores the result. If the condition is true, the result is 1; otherwise, 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    Tensor
    get()
    Retrieves and removes the top tensor from the internal queue. If the queue is empty, an error message is printed and null is returned.
    Tensor
    get(String name)
    Retrieves and removes the top tensor associated with the given name. If no tensor with that name exists in the queue, an error is printed and null is returned.
    void
    getEnvironmentStatus()
    Prints the current system and CuBridge environment status.
    static CuBridge
    getInstance()
    Returns the singleton instance of CuBridge.
    int
    getMemSize()
    Returns the total number of tensors currently allocated in memory.
    int
    getQueueSize()
    Returns the current number of tensors in the internal queue.
    CuBridge
    gt()
    Applies element-wise greater-than comparison (a > b) to the top two tensors in the queue. If the condition is true, the result is 1; otherwise, 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    gt(String a)
    Applies element-wise greater-than comparison (a > b) using the specified tensor as the first operand. The second operand is taken from the top of the queue. If the condition is true, the result is 1; otherwise, 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    gt(String a, String b)
    Applies element-wise greater-than comparison (a > b) using the two specified tensors. If the condition is true, the result is 1; otherwise, 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    gt(String a, String b, String out)
    Applies element-wise greater-than comparison (a > b) using the two specified tensors and stores the result. If the condition is true, the result is 1; otherwise, 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    le()
    Applies element-wise less-than-or-equal comparison (a ≤ b) to the top two tensors in the queue. If the condition is true, the result is 1; otherwise, 0. If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.

    mse()

    CuBridge
    mse(String yh)

    CuBridge

    CuBridge
    mse(String yh, String y, String out)
    Computes the MSE loss between the specified prediction and target tensors and stores the result. Returns a scalar (1x1 tensor) representing the total loss in the specified output tensor. Both tensors must have the same shape. If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.

    transpose()
    Transposes the last two axes of the top tensor in the queue. If the input is a 1D vector, it is automatically reshaped to a column vector (n, 1) before transposition. This operation does not affect leading axes (only the two innermost dimensions are swapped). If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    transpose(String name)
    Transposes the last two axes of the specified tensor. If the input is a 1D vector, it is automatically reshaped to a column vector (n, 1) before transposition. This operation does not affect leading axes (only the two innermost dimensions are swapped). If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
    CuBridge
    transpose(String name, String out)
    Transposes the last two axes of the specified tensor and stores the result under a new name. If the input is a 1D vector, it is automatically reshaped to a column vector (n, 1) before transposition. This operation does not affect leading axes (only the two innermost dimensions are swapped). If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static CuBridge getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of CuBridge.
      Returns:
      the CuBridge instance

    • selectRam

      public void selectRam()
      Sets the memory storage mode to RAM (host memory). Disables auto-detection.

    • selectVRam

      public void selectVRam()
      Sets the memory storage mode to VRAM (GPU memory). Disables auto-detection.

    • selectCPU

      public void selectCPU()
      Sets the computation mode to CPU. Disables auto-detection.

    • envReset

      public void envReset()
      Resets the environment to auto-detection mode. Memory and computation mode will be automatically selected.

    • RamStat

      public boolean RamStat()
      Returns the current memory mode.
      Returns:
      true if using VRAM; false if using RAM

    • CalStat

      public boolean CalStat()
      Returns the current computation mode.
      Returns:
      true if using GPU; false if using CPU

    • EnvStat

      public boolean EnvStat()
      Returns whether the system is in auto-detection mode.
      Returns:
      true if auto mode is enabled

    • getEnvironmentStatus

      public void getEnvironmentStatus()
      Prints the current system and CuBridge environment status.

      This includes both general system information and CUDA-related configuration, and reflects the current CuBridge runtime environment.

      • Operating system and physical system RAM
      • Detected GPU name and available VRAM (if CUDA is available)
      • Installed CUDA Driver and Runtime version (only shown if CUDA is installed)
      • CuBridge auto-detection status (for CUDA availability)
      • Current compute mode (CPU or GPU)
      • Active memory storage location (RAM or VRAM)

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears all tensors from the internal queue and memory.

    • getQueueSize

      public int getQueueSize()
      Returns the current number of tensors in the internal queue.
      Returns:
      the size of the queue

    • visualQueue

      public void visualQueue()
      Prints the top tensor from the internal execution queue. This tensor is the next to be used in computation. Equivalent to peeking the front of the queue.

    • visualQueue

      public void visualQueue(String name)
      Prints the queue stack of a specific tensor name. This shows all stacked TensorMeta instances associated with the given name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the tensor to inspect

    • visualQueueAll

      public void visualQueueAll()
      Prints the entire queue contents for all tensor names.
      • Includes all names currently managed by the queue system
      • Displays the full stack of each tensor

    • getMemSize

      public int getMemSize()
      Returns the total number of tensors currently allocated in memory.
      Returns:
      the number of active memory blocks

    • visualMem

      public void visualMem(String name)
      Prints the memory allocation status of a specific tensor.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the tensor to visualize

    • visualMemAll

      public void visualMemAll()
      Prints the memory allocation status of all tensors.

    • put

      public CuBridge put(int data)
      • Stores an integer scalar as an unnamed tensor.
      • This tensor is automatically marked as broadcastable.
      • When used in binary operations, it must appear as the second operand.
      Parameters:
      data - the integer value to store
      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

    • put

      public CuBridge put(int data, String name)
      • Stores an integer scalar as a named tensor.
      • This tensor is automatically marked as broadcastable.
      • When used in binary operations, it must appear as the second operand.
      Parameters:
      data - the integer value to store
      name - the name to assign to the tensor
      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

    • put

      public CuBridge put(int data, String name, int usageCount)
      • Stores an integer scalar with a name and usage count.
      • This tensor is automatically marked as broadcastable.
      • When used in binary operations, it must appear as the second operand.
      Parameters:
      data - the integer value to store
      name - the tensor name
      usageCount - number of times this tensor will be used (must be > 0 or -1)
      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

      public CuBridge put(Tensor data)

      • This is typically used for temporary tensors. Name will be "".
      Parameters:
      data - the tensor to store
      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

      • Stores a tensor with an empty name and specified broadcasting flag.
      Parameters:

      broadcast - whether to mark this tensor as broadcastable
      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

      • Stores a named tensor with default usage count and no broadcasting.
      Parameters:
      data - the tensor to store
      name - the tensor name (must not be empty)
      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

      • Stores a named tensor with specified broadcasting flag.
      Parameters:
      data - the tensor to store

      broadcast - whether to mark this tensor as broadcastable

      CuBridge instance for chaining

    • put

      public CuBridge put(Tensor data, String name, int usageCount)
      • Stores a named tensor with a specific usage count.
      Parameters:
      data - the tensor to store
      name - the tensor name (must not be empty)
      usageCount - number of times this tensor will be used (must be > 0 or -1)
      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

    • put

      public CuBridge put(Tensor data, String name, int usageCount, boolean broadcast)
      • Stores a tensor with complete configuration: name, usage count, and broadcasting flag.
      • If the name is null or empty, an error is printed.
      • If the usage count is 0 or negative (except -1), an error is printed.
      • If the name already exists, the tensor will not be stored.
      Parameters:
      data - the tensor to store
      name - the tensor name
      usageCount - number of times this tensor will be used (-1 for unlimited)
      broadcast - whether to mark this tensor as broadcastable
      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

    • get

      public Tensor get()
      • Retrieves and removes the top tensor from the internal queue.
      • If the queue is empty, an error message is printed and null is returned.
      Returns:
      the retrieved Tensor, or null if the queue is empty

    • get

      public Tensor get(String name)
      • Retrieves and removes the top tensor associated with the given name.
      • If no tensor with that name exists in the queue, an error is printed and null is returned.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the tensor to retrieve
      Returns:
      the retrieved Tensor, or null if not found

    • duple

      public CuBridge duple(String name, int usageCount)
      • Increases the usage count of an existing tensor in the execution queue.
      • This method searches for a tensor with the given name in the current queue and increments its internal usage count.
      • The tensor itself is not duplicated or copied; only its metadata is updated.
      • Note: This operation is local to the execution queue and does not interact with the map.
      • If the usage count is less than 1, or the tensor is not found in the queue, the operation fails.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the tensor in the queue
      usageCount - the number of additional times this tensor should be allowed to be used (must be ≥ 1)
      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

    • abs

      public CuBridge abs()
      • Applies absolute value (|x|) to the top tensor in the queue.
      • All operations are performed element-wise on the tensor.
      • If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

      public CuBridge abs(String a)

      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

    • dot

      public CuBridge dot()
      • Performs dot product (a ⋅ b) between the last two axes of the top two tensors in the queue.
      • The last axis of a must match the second-to-last axis of b.
      • All other axes must match.
      • Use transpose() to reshape 1D vectors to (n,1) if needed.
      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

    • dot

      public CuBridge dot(String a)
      • Performs dot product (a ⋅ b) using the specified tensor as the first operand.
      • The second operand is taken from the top of the queue.
      • The last axis of a must match the second-to-last axis of b.
      • All leading axes must match.
      • Reshape 1D vectors to (n,1) if necessary.
      Parameters:
      a - the name of the first input tensor
      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

    • dot

      public CuBridge dot(String a, String b)
      • Performs dot product (a ⋅ b) using the two specified tensors.
      • The last axis of a must match the second-to-last axis of b.
      • All other axes must be equal.
      • If either tensor is a 1D vector, use transpose() to convert it to (n,1).
      Parameters:
      a - the first input tensor
      b - the second input tensor
      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

    • dot

      public CuBridge dot(String a, String b, String out)
      • Performs dot product (a ⋅ b) between the last two axes of the two specified tensors and stores the result.
      • The last axis of a must match the second-to-last axis of b.
      • All leading axes must have the same shape; otherwise, the operation fails.
      • Use transpose() to reshape 1D vectors to (n, 1) if needed.
      Parameters:
      a - the name of the first input tensor
      b - the name of the second input tensor
      out - the name for the output tensor
      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

    • gt

      public CuBridge gt()
      • Applies element-wise greater-than comparison (a > b) to the top two tensors in the queue.
      • If the condition is true, the result is 1; otherwise, 0.
      • If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

    • gt

      public CuBridge gt(String a)
      • Applies element-wise greater-than comparison (a > b) using the specified tensor as the first operand.
      • The second operand is taken from the top of the queue.
      • If the condition is true, the result is 1; otherwise, 0.
      • If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Parameters:
      a - the name of the first input tensor
      Returns:
      CuBridge instance for chaining

      • If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.

      • Each element is treated as boolean: non-zero as true, zero as false.

    • sum

      public CuBridge sum(int axis)
      Computes the sum over all axes of the top tensor in the queue.
      • If axis = -1, sums all elements in the tensor.
      • If axis ≥ 0, computes the sum from the innermost axis up to and including the given axis.
      • If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Parameters:
      axis - the dimension along which to compute the sum
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining

    • var

      public CuBridge var(String a, int axis, String out)
      Computes the variance over the specified axis of the given tensor and stores the result.
      • If axis = -1, computes the variance of all elements in the tensor.
      • If axis ≥ 0, aggregates all axes from the innermost to the given axis (inclusive) to compute the variance.
      • If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Parameters:
      a - the name of the input tensor
      axis - the axis up to which variance is computed (inclusive); -1 means full reduction
      out - the name for the output tensor
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining

      • If axis ≥ 0, aggregates all axes from the innermost to the given axis (inclusive) to compute the std.
      • If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Parameters:
      axis - the dimension along which to compute the sum
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining

    • argmax

      public CuBridge argmax(int axis)
      Finds the index of the maximum value along the specified axis of the top tensor in the queue.
      • This function does not support axis = -1.
      • The maximum is computed along the specified axis only.
      • Returns the index tensor with the same shape except for the reduced axis.
      • If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Parameters:
      axis - the axis along which to find the index of the maximum
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining

    • transpose

      public CuBridge transpose()
      • Transposes the last two axes of the top tensor in the queue.
      • If the input is a 1D vector, it is automatically reshaped to a column vector (n, 1) before transposition.
      • This operation does not affect leading axes (only the two innermost dimensions are swapped).
      • If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining

    • compress

      public CuBridge compress(int axis, boolean avg)
      • Compresses the specified axis of the top tensor by either summing or averaging its values.
      • Set avg to true to use average, or false to use sum.
      • Only the specified axis is compressed; all other axes remain unchanged.
      • If no suitable tensor is found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Parameters:
      axis - the axis to compress
      avg - whether to average (true) or sum (false)
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining

      • Repeats the elements along the specified axis of the top tensor n times.
      • This operation only works if the size of the given axis is exactly 1.
      • If the condition is not met or the tensor is not found, an error message is printed and the operation fails.
      Parameters:
      axis - the axis to repeat
      n - the number of repetitions
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining

    • mse

      public CuBridge mse()
      • Computes the Mean Squared Error (MSE) loss between the top two tensors in the queue.
      • Returns a scalar (1x1 tensor) representing the total loss.
      • Both tensors must have the same shape.
      • If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining

    • mse

      public CuBridge mse(String yh)
      • Computes the MSE loss between the specified prediction tensor and the top target tensor.
      • Returns a scalar (1x1 tensor) representing the total loss.
      • Both tensors must have the same shape.
      • If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Parameters:
      yh - the name of the predicted output tensor
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining

    • mse

      public CuBridge mse(String yh, String y)
      • Computes the MSE loss between the specified prediction and target tensors.
      • Returns a scalar (1x1 tensor) representing the total loss.
      • Both tensors must have the same shape.
      • If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Parameters:
      yh - the name of the predicted output tensor
      y - the name of the target tensor
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining

    • mse

      public CuBridge mse(String yh, String y, String out)
      • Computes the MSE loss between the specified prediction and target tensors and stores the result.
      • Returns a scalar (1x1 tensor) representing the total loss in the specified output tensor.
      • Both tensors must have the same shape.
      • If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Parameters:
      yh - the name of the predicted output tensor
      y - the name of the target tensor
      out - the name for the output tensor
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining

    • cee

      public CuBridge cee()
      • Computes the Cross-Entropy Error (CEE) loss between the top two tensors in the queue.
      • Returns a scalar (1x1 tensor) representing the total loss.
      • Both tensors must have the same shape.
      • If any input contains negative values, the result will be NaN.
      • If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining

    • affine

      public CuBridge affine()
      • Performs affine transformation: a · b + c.
      • Ensure the last axis of tensor a matches the second-to-last axis of tensor b for valid dot product.
      • Tensor c must have the same size as the number of columns in the resulting matrix (i.e., last axis of b).
      • Broadcasting is allowed for tensor c; its broadcasting setting does not affect correctness.
      • If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining

    • affine

      public CuBridge affine(String a)
      • Performs affine transformation: a · b + c using the specified input tensor a.
      • The dot product a · b requires the last axis of a to match the second-to-last axis of b.
      • Tensor c must match the output column size (last axis of b), and may be broadcasted.
      • If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Parameters:
      a - the name of the input tensor
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining

    • affine

      public CuBridge affine(String a, String b)
      • Performs affine transformation: a · b + c using the specified tensors a and b.
      • Ensure the last axis of a equals the second-to-last axis of b for valid matrix multiplication.
      • Tensor c must match the number of columns in b and may be broadcasted if needed.
      • If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Parameters:
      a - the name of the input tensor
      b - the name of the weight tensor
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining

    • affine

      public CuBridge affine(String a, String b, String c)
      • Performs affine transformation: a · b + c using the specified tensors a, b, and c.
      • Valid dot product requires last axis of a = second-to-last axis of b.
      • c must have the same size as the output column dimension (last axis of b), and broadcasting is allowed.
      • If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Parameters:
      a - the name of the input tensor
      b - the name of the weight tensor
      c - the name of the bias tensor
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining

    • affine

      public CuBridge affine(String a, String b, String c, String out)
      • Performs affine transformation: a · b + c and stores the result in the specified output tensor.
      • Valid dot product requires last axis of a = second-to-last axis of b.
      • c must match the output's column count and may be broadcasted regardless of its setting.
      • If no suitable tensors are found, the operation fails and an error message is printed.
      Parameters:
      a - the name of the input tensor
      b - the name of the weight tensor
      c - the name of the bias tensor
      out - the name for the output tensor
      Returns:
      public CuBridge instance for chaining
